msDesc.head: Bonaventura; Jean Gerson; Adam of Dryburgh, etc.

msItem.author: Bonaventure
msItem.title: Itinerarium mentis in Deum
msItem.rubric: Prologus Itinerarii mentis in Deum compilati a Bonaventura ordinis fratrum minorum generali ministro
msItem.incipit: In principio primum principium
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Itinerarius mentis in Deum Bonaventura doctoris seraphici ordinis fratrum minorum, finivi in die S. Benedicti abbatis Anno domini 1452.
msItem.note: Ed. S. Bonaventurae Opera Omnia v, Quaracchi, 1891, pp. 295–313. Our MS. (as Melk B. 23) was listed in the Prolegomena, p. xxx, no. 64, but not used for the edition.

msItem.author: Ps.-Bonaventure
msItem.title: De septem gradibus contemplationis
msItem.rubric: Compendium doctoris seraphici de vil gradibus contemplationis
msItem.incipit: Contemplativorum aquilinos obtutus acui
msItem.note: The 7th gradus ends
Then follows
msItem.rubric: Epilogatio premissorum
msItem.incipit: Ordinem dictorum graduum

msItem.note: The original version of this work is now ascribed to Thomas Gallus, sec G. Théry, Thomas Gallus et Egide d’Assise, le traité De septem gradibus contemplationis , Rev. néo-scolastique 36 (1934), 183–90. Our MS. is a copy of the third version, which may be by a certain Jacobus, see S. Bonav. Op. Omnia cit. viii, 1898, p. cxiv. This version has not been printed. It is also in MS. Laud Misc. 479, 15th cent., from the Carthusians of Mainz, fol. 114.

msItem.author: Bonaventure
msItem.title: De triplici uia
msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus Bonaventure de triplici actu ierarchico sive de triplici modo se exercendi
msItem.incipit: Ecce descripsi tibi
msItem.explicit: (p. 70) et amplexum. Ad quod nos perducat Ihesus Christus in secula seculorum benedictus. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit Bonaventura de triplici actu ierarchico.
msItem.note: Ed. S. Bonav. Op. Omnia cit. viii, pp. 3–158. This is the incomplete version found in many MSS., ending at ch. lii § 7.

msItem.title: De libris legendis a monacho
msItem.rubric: Tractatulus responsivus ad questionem monachi Carthusiensis querentis an pro exercitio spirituali liceat conventum dimittere et qui libri fructuosius sint legendi, Reverendi magistri Iohannis Gerson Cancellarii Parisiensis. Prologus epistularis

msItem.incipit: Grada et pax. Si inimicos iubemur diligere
msItem.explicit: (p. 74) Scriptum Lugduni anno domini 1426 per me Iohannem Cane. Paris.

msItem.rubric: Incipiunt considerationes ad propositum. Consideratio prima
msItem.incipit: Religiosus ille consideret in primis

msItem.finalRubric: Explicit anno etc. Liiiº in vigilia Andree.
msItem.note: Pr. L.E. du Pin, Gersonii Opera Omnia 1706, ii, col. 704–10; the introductory letter also ed. P. Glorieux, Jean Gerson, œuvres complètes 11, 1961, pp. 275–6, and see p. xxvii: Ep. 57 to Michel Bartine. Glorieux cites our MS., as Melk 58.

msItem.rubric: Item Epistula eiusdem magistri Iohannis Gerson de religionis perfectione ac moderamine missa ad Carthusiam cuidam monacho quem in seculo noverat eo quod medicus domini Saludarum fuerit
msItem.incipit: Gracia vobis et pax in Christo Ihesu. Utique dicetis mihi per similitudinem
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, 11, col. 682–92; ed. Glorieux, ii, pp. 232–45, and see p. xxv: Ep. 49 to Guillaume Minaudi. Glorieux again cites our MS.

msItem.rubric: Sequitur questio predicti magistri, scilicet Gerson, de peccato detractionis utilis valde
msItem.incipit: Queritur an male loqui de aliis
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, 11, col. 463–70.

msItem.rubric: Sequitur tractatulus eiusdem, scilicet Gerson, de meditatione cordis, utilis valde, considerationes habet 17
msItem.incipit: Meditatio cordis mei in conspectu tuo
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, m, coL 449–56. As in the edition by Richer, Paris, 1606, iii, 364–70, the last paragraph but one (beg.: Advertendum quid, ends: monitione sapientis) has been omitted; see Glorieux, ed. cit. 1, p. 57.

msItem.rubric: Sequitur tractatus eiusdem de simplificatione cordis continens considerationes 23
msItem.incipit: In simplicitate cordis querite ilium
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus Gerson de simplificatione cordis vel eciam stabilitacione ac mundificacione.
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, in, col. 457–67.
Followed by a note in red: Hic sequi deberet tractatus de directione cordis in quo quia multa que in tractatu de oratione qui hic sequitur ponuntur, ideo obmisus est hic scribi etc. P. 141B is blank.

msItem.rubric: Magistri Iohannis Gerson. / Tractatus cuius supra editus in Concilio Constantiensi de oratione et valore eius sub pluribus considerationibus. Prima pars est manuductiva in ipsius considerationes, ostendens proprie pertinere ad monachi vocationem et professionem orationi insistere, in qua qualis esse debeat ipsum instruit
msItem.incipit: Oportet semper orare et nunquam deficere
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus magistri Iohannis Gerson de oratione et eius valore.
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, in, col. 247–62.

msItem.rubric: Sequitur Tractatus eiusdem de preparatione misse. Qui alias intytulatur de pollucionibus nocturnis
msItem.incipit: (p. 178) Dubitatum est aput me frequenter
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, in, col. 323–34.

msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus eiusdem Reverendi magistri Iohannis cancellarii de cognitione castitatis seu de pollutionibus diurnis seu in vigilia
msItem.incipit: Scripsi pridem aliqua super preparatione ad missam
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, in, col. 335–45.

msItem.rubric: Responsio eiusdem magistri scilicet Gerson de modo confessionis et absolutionis sacramentalis super questione sibi facta de statuto ordinis Carthusiensium quo dicitur. Nullus absolvat a mortali certo, sed confitentem remittat ad priorem suum
msItem.incipit: Confessio sacramentalis fundatur
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, 11, col. 460–1: this is the first part only of the printed text.

msItem.rubric: Magistralis et brevis distinctio predicti magistri de modis excommunicationum et irregularitatum et absolutionis ab eisdem
msItem.incipit: Excommunicationum tot sunt genera

msItem.rubric: De iniunctione penitentie
msItem.incipit: Sed et de iniunctione penitentie

msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, 11, col. 403–5.

msItem.rubric: Sequitur tractatus eiusdem de sollicitudine ecclesiasticorum ad fratres Celestinos scriptus, primo tamen premittuntur dubia sibi de eadem materia proposita
msItem.incipit: Queritur responsio super dubiis sequentibus
msItem.explicit: (p. 270) intelligencias vestras in Christo Ihesu domino nostro. Amen.
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, 11, col. 597–617.

msItem.rubric: Ex tractatu eiusdem egregii doctoris de contractibus notabilis sententia ponitur hic, et est pro consolatione religiosorum
msItem.incipit: Argumentum sumptum ex consilio solo
msItem.explicit: (p. 272) discutiendis occupent se. Amen. Et tantum ex uno tractatu, scilicet de contractibus.
msItem.note: This is most of Propositio 13 of the De contractibus, pr. du Pin, iii, col. 180D–181C6.

msItem.rubric: Incipit tractatus predicti doctoris eggregii et cancellarii Parisiensis de theologia mistica, qui alias intitulatur de contemplacione speculative et practice tradita. Et est tractatus multum egregius. Prologus
msItem.incipit: Astrinxit me promissio novissima
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatus de mistica theologia reverendi magistri Iohannis Gerson cancellarii Parisiensis, viri illuminatissimi.
msItem.note: Ed. A. Combes, Io. Carl. de Gerson, De Mystica Theologia, Lugano, 1958, pp. 1–123. He uses our MS. (y). Also ed. Glorieux, ed. cit. iii, 1962, pp. 250–92 (no. 100). He cites our MS. on p. xiii.

msItem.title: De Mystica Theologia, Tractatus practicus
msItem.rubric: Sequitur tractatus eiusdem doctoris de duodecim industriis in misticam theologiam (p. 353) De xii industriis
msItem.incipit: Tractantes in lectionibus nostris
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit de xii industriis ad contemplationem recensitus ab actore anno domini 1422 in novemb. in Lugduno.
msItem.note: Ed. Combes, op. cit., pp. 125–216. He uses our MS.

msItem.rubric: Incipit opusculum ad elucidationem scolasticam théologie mistice sub duodecim considerationibus a predicto doctore, scilicet Gerson, compilatum
msItem.incipit: Vobis datum est nosse misterium
msItem.explicit: (p. 417) dona hominibus. In cuius commemoratione sollempnitatis hec scripta sunt Lugduni ad elucidacionem scolasticam théologie mistice consistentis in amore per reverendum magistrum Iohannem Gerson cancellarium Parisiensem anno millesimo quadringentesimo vicesimo nono, prima iunii etc.
msItem.note: Ed. Combes, op. cit., pp. 221–34. He uses our MS.

msItem.rubric: Sequitur doctrina eiusdem per modum tractatuli utilis valde pro devotis simplicibus qualiter se in suis exerciciis discrete et caute habeant originaliter per ipsum edita in vulgari gallico, in latinum per alium translata ut apparet (p. 418) ex stilo. De discretione in genere
msItem.incipit: Deus vult ut sit racionabile obsequium nostrum
msItem.explicit: (p. 445) divinam caritatem. Sibi laus gloria et gratiarum actio semper. Amen.
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatulus iste perutilis valde reverendi atque excellentissimi magistri Iohannis Gerson.
msItem.note: Pr. du Pin, iii, col. 605–18. An amplification, not by Gerson, of his French treatise against having a too scrupulous conscience. See Glorieux, ed. cit. 1, p. 58.

msItem.rubric: Ex eiusdem egregii doctoris tractatu qui intitulatur tractatus conclusionum sequenda sunt exerpta
msItem.incipit: Ea que tibi precepit Deus
msItem.note: Extracts from Gerson’s De regulis mandatorum, i (parts only), iii, iv, v (part only), vii (part only), viii, xvii (part only), xxi (part only), xxix (part of end only), xxxii (parts only), xxxin (part only), xxxvii (end), l (end), lxxxii (part only), xc (part), xciii, xcvi (part), xcviii, c (part), li, lii, c (part), cii (end), cxv, cxvi (part), cxvii, cxxii (part), cxxxii-cxxxiv, cxxxviii (parts). Pr. du Pin, iii, col. 77A-B6, C8-D4; 78B5–79 1. 3; 79A15-B2, B13-C8; 80B13-C4; 81B19-C8; 83B7–10; 84A5–8, A15-B5, B14-C10; 85B8–13; 87B15-C5; 92D2–5; 93D4–94 1. 7; 94B8–14, Cio-Di, D8–10; 95C15-D4; 87C7–88 1. 2; 95D5–12; 96A17–B2; 99C14–100A4; 100A10–14, C13–17; 102B11-C12, C18-D10; 103C13–18, C10–13. Pp. 453 B-c are blank.

msItem.title: Devotional treatise
msItem.rubric: De devotione et diversis generibus devotorum excerpta ex dictis cuiusdam doctoris théologie Karthusiensis ordinis
msItem.incipit: Nota quod devotio est voluntas quedam prompte tradens se ad ea que pertinent ad Dei famulatum
msItem.explicit: (p. 475) quia iste doctor valde extense loquitur de eis, scilicet begardiis.

msItem.author: Adam of Dryburgh
msItem.title: Soliloquium de instructione animae
msItem.rubric: Incipit Soliloquium fratris Adam
msItem.incipit: Dominis suis venerandis et amicis in Christi visceribus
msItem.finalRubric: Explicit tractatulus iste. Anno etc. liiiº.
msItem.note: Ed. B. Pez, Thés. Anecd. Nov. I, pt. 11, 1721, col. 337–72 and see 1, 1, p. lxxi-lxxii; he used our MS., then MS. Melk lit. B. 23, as well as one from Gaming. Reprinted from Pez in PL 198 col. 843–72. For the attribution to Adam, also known as Adam Scot, and a list of further MSS., see A. Wilmart, Magister Adam Cartusiensis, Mélanges Mandonnet 11 (1930), 153 n. I, 155. There was a copy of the work in the Charterhouse of Aggsbach, near Melk, in the 15th cent.; see Gottlieb, Mittelalt. Bibl.kat. Österreichs I (1915), 599 1. 16 (MS. H. 4).
In the blank space on p. 525 the scribe wrote a detailed list of contents.
msItem.incipit: In presenti libello continentur infra notata. / Primo Itinerarius mentis in Deum doctoris seraphici / …

msItem.note: Inside the front binding another hand has written:
msItem.quote: Contenta huius libelli quere in fine.

msItem.note: On pp. 71–2, which were originally blank, the scribe added some excerpts:

msItem.rubric: Quedam notabilia et valde edificatoria
msItem.note: Short extracts on repentance attributed to Chrysostomus (partly from the Opus Imperfectum), the Vitae patrum, Seneca and Gregory.

msItem.rubric: Materia optima contra superbos
msItem.incipit: Nota. Super evangelio, Attendite a falsis prophetis etc. Yppocrite, non missi, sed sua presumptione et superbia alios docent
msItem.explicit: Honores monstrant mores. Hec in illa postilla. Y.(?) P(er).

msItem.note: A written leaf has been cut out after p. 72.
The parchment flyleaves (pp. i–ii, 526–7) are two cut-down leaves, possibly consecutive, from a late 13th cent.(?) collection of sermons or notes for sermons. Incipits included are:

msItem.incipit: Positus est hic in signum, etc. Luc. Solus Christus positus est in ruinam malorum
Beatus Iohannes evangelista qui in spiritu Domini vidit secreta celestia
Post triduum invenerunt eum parentes eius in templo. Luc. Consuetudo fuit apud iudeos
Nuptie facte sunt in Chana Galee. Debemus scire quod matrimonium tripliciter institutum est
Et factum est post triduum. Luc. In hoc evangelio tria docemur. Primo quod dolere debemus de Dei amissione.

msItem.note: Some of the strips of parchment used to strengthen the sewing are taken from the same MS.

The front pastedown is a leaf from a 15th-cent. paper MS. It contains notes on the chapter divisions of Maccabees II, on the position of the 8 non-canonical books of the O.T., and on the number of chapters in various books of the O.T.

supportDesc.support: paper, watermarks, scales in circle, or in cartouche, close to Briquet 2467 and 2469
supportDesc.extent: ii+530 pages (p. 141 is double, 453 is treble, pp. i–ii, 526–7 are flyleaves), 145 108

handDesc.handNote: Written, probably in Austria, in 1452–3 (see pp. 45, 82, 525) in a current fere-hybrida

binding.p: Contemporary binding of wooden boards covered with white leather, with one metal clasp (similar to one of those on MS. Lyell 60) on leather strap, fastening to edge of upper cover; sewing strengthened in the middle of the quires with strips of parchment taken from manuscripts; two 15th–16th-cent. parchment labels, with list of contents and shelfmark.

history.provenance: Belonged to the Abbey of Melk in Austria and was probably copied there. On p. 1031s the 15th-cent. note: Tiber iste est monasterii Mellicensis’ and the MS. was no. C. 97 in the 1483 Melk catalogue (Gottlieb, op. cit., p. 187). The parchment label on the front cover with the shelfmark D. 31 possibly derives from Stephan Burchard’s catalogue made between 1507 and 1517, see Gottlieb, p. 139. On p. 1 are the 17th-cent.(?) notes: Monasterii Mellicensis, and lit. D. 31: the second is in the same hand as the similar note in MS. Lyell 60 (fol. 1r). The MS. had the shelfmark B. 23 (probably given it by B. Pez, see Gottlieb, p. 141) by 1721 (see item 4 above). No. 58 (B. 23) in Cat. Codd. MSS’ MeUic. 1, 1889, pp. 109–13.
Bought by Lyell in December 1937 from E. P. Goldschmidt and Co.; see his Cat. 100, no. 1.
history.acquisition: Chosen as one of the hundred manuscripts bequeathed to the Bodleian by Lyell in 1948.

recordHist.source: Summary description abbreviated from A. de la Mare, Catalogue of the Medieval Manuscripts Bequeathed to the Bodleian Library Oxford by James P. R. Lyell (1971) Catalogue, p. 185 Catalogue, p. 186 Catalogue, p. 187 Catalogue, p. 188 Catalogue, p. 189 Catalogue, p. 190

listBibl.bibl: A. Watson, Catalogue of Dated and Datable Manuscripts in Oxford Libraries (1984), no. 640

revisionDesc.change: Andrew Dunning Revised from description by Albinia de la Mare.
